noun.description: An octopus, cuttlefish, or other cephalopod; = "polypus".

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in Philemon Holland (1552–1637), translator. From French poulpe (1554 in Middle French; slightly earlier as † poulpre, † poupe) from classical Latin pōlypus. Compare Catalan polp, Spanish pulpo, Italian polpo.
